title: Effective Language Instructional Design Strategies Using Media Comparison and TPACK

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental instructional design theories and language education experience
context.additional_context: A course for corporate secondary language education managers/leaders to acquire effective instructional design methods in limited technological environments (primarily smartphone-based).

learning_goals: By applying media comparison research methods (media-variable, media-method integrated variable), participants can establish optimal media selection strategies for language education contexts.
Using the TPACK frameworkâ€™s technology-pedagogy-content knowledge integration model, participants can propose practical solutions for language lesson design.
Participants can measure learner outcomes through project-based assessment designs utilizing smartphone-based media in large-scale offline environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
